title: Trip.com is Finally Ready for Takeoff
sub_head: Resilient domestic travel in China helped the company survive the worst of 2020. Investors are betting a vaccine will add some fuel to the tank.
body:
Getting the pandemic under control in China has helped the country’s online travel giant Trip.com ride out a turbulent year. But a smooth ride in 2021 depends on a strong rebound in international travel.
The company’s revenue for the quarter ending in September was down 48% from a year earlier, the company reported Tuesday after the market closed, but that was a marked improvement from the 64% decline in the previous quarter. While Trip.com’s international business is still in limbo, its domestic business has rebounded strongly...
